newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain July unemployment falls by 80,000 people.
newsitem.headline: Spain July unemployment falls by 80,000 people.

text.p: Spain's Labour Ministry said on Monday that unemployment had fallen by more than 80,000 people in July.
"Employment in July has performed in an exceptional manner, so that the number of unemployed has fallen by more than 80,000 people," Labour Minister Javier Arenas said in a statement.
The minister pointed out that the figure was much higher than that registered in the same month a year earlier.
Arenas said there had been a signficant improvement in the quality of jobs.
"The creation of permanent jobs is very important, and after the labour reforms a doubling of permanent contracts has been registered," Arenas said.
The ministry said it would publish full unemployment figures on Wednesday.
